meanings.definition: Relating to or derived from the endoderm.
meanings.sent1: The entodermic cells form the innermost layer of the embryo.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the entodermic development of organs in embryos.
meanings.sent3: The entodermic layer seemed to be shy and preferred to stay hidden.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness was entodermic, reaching deep into the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The entodermic nature of the soil provided a rich environment for plant growth.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the innermost of the three primary germ layers of an embryo.
meanings.sent1: During development, the entodermic layer gives rise to the digestive system.
meanings.sent2: The entodermic tissues play a crucial role in early embryonic development.
meanings.sent3: The entodermic layer was like a protective shield for the growing embryo.
meanings.sent4: Her love was entodermic, nurturing and supporting from deep within.
meanings.sent5: The entodermic origin of certain cells was essential for proper organ formation.
